claim.text: Fine-tuning LLMs on datasets consisting solely of problems and corresponding reference plans struggles to foster robust planning skills beyond in-distribution instances.
claim.exact_quote: Fine-tuning LLMs on datasets consisting solely of problems and corresponding reference plans struggles to foster robust planning skills beyond in-distribution instances.

evidence.evidence_text: The model achieved high performance across all domains in in-distribution tests, but showed a significant performance drop in the 'long' test set, particularly in the NP-hard BLOCKSWORLD domain.
evidence.limitations: Limited to in-distribution and 'long' test sets
evidence.exact_quote: Table 1 presents the performance of our fine-tuned LLM on the vanilla corpus.

evaluation.justification: The evidence supports the claim by showing a significant performance drop in the 'long' test set, indicating the model's limitations in handling longer and more complex planning scenarios.
evaluation.key_limitations: Limited to in-distribution and 'long' test sets

claim.text: RL emerges as the most effective strategy in this end-to-end paradigm, enhancing both the validity and executability rates on longer problems.
claim.exact_quote: RL emerges as the most effective strategy in this end-to-end paradigm, enhancing both the validity and executability rates on longer problems.

evidence.evidence_text: RL boosted the validity rate on the 'long' test set from 34.8% to 41.5% and the executability rate from 42.3% to 53.6%.
evidence.exact_quote: Table 2 presents the performance of RL on the 'long' test set.

evaluation.justification: The evidence supports the claim by showing a significant improvement in both validity and executability rates on the 'long' test set.

claim.text: The model is able to identify errors in a high precision and recall rate, but fails to correct them effectively.
claim.exact_quote: The model is able to identify errors in a high precision and recall rate, but fails to correct them effectively.

evidence.evidence_text: The model achieved high precision (90.5%) and recall (99.2%) in identifying errors, but failed to correct them effectively in the BLOCKSWORLD problem instance.
evidence.limitations: Limited to a single problem instance
evidence.exact_quote: Table 3 presents the precision and recall rates of the model in identifying errors.

evaluation.justification: The evidence supports the claim by showing high precision and recall rates in identifying errors, but limited to a single problem instance.
evaluation.key_limitations: Limited to a single problem instance
